The Herm Trident Ferry sails daily from the St Peter Port Harbour.  It usually leaves from 'Cambridge Steps' but can also depart from either the 'Weighbridge' or 'Inter-Island Quay' depending on the height of the tide.  
The first and last boats always leave from Cambridge Steps.  You will be told from where the boat will depart as you buy your ticket from the Trident Kiosk located at the 'Weighbridge'.  If you are in any doubt telephone either the kiosk on +44 1481 721379 or Herm Island on +44 1481 722377.
As there are no cars or motorbikes on Herm, you have to walk, except from the harbor steps where a tractor can be arranged to come and pick you up.
Herm has several beaches, with one, Shell beach described as a 'beautifully quiet beach with superb sand', and another, Belvoir Bay as 'fantastic'

On Herm, there are several things to do despite the size of it. There is a pub (The Mermaid Tavern), two shops, and several beaches. On one of the beaches, Shell Beach, in the summer you can hire kayaks.

value: There is an island shop which sells clothes, jewellry, souvenirs, sweets and more.
At Shell Beach, there is a refreshment kiosk where you can buy drinks, sweets and other such foodstuffs.

The Mermaid Tavern is a pub like area in which you can eat outdoors. There is also the White House, which is more of a restaurant, and has dining areas inside or outside.

There is currently only one hotel on Herm, The White House Hotel (+44 1481 722159). There are also several self-catering cottages and a camping ground. All accommodation facilities on the island are run by the family firm that own the head lease on the island. The main website for all these is
